meanings.definition: Superlative form of deaf, meaning unable to hear.
meanings.sent1: The music was so loud that even the deafest person could feel the vibrations.
meanings.sent2: She wore the deafest earplugs to block out the noise.
meanings.sent3: The deafest cat in the neighborhood slept through the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was so strong that it reached even the deafest corners of his soul.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the forest was the deafest he had ever experienced.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of deaf, meaning unwilling to listen or respond.
meanings.sent1: Despite his friend's warnings, he remained the deafest to their advice.
meanings.sent2: She gave him the deafest look when he asked the same question for the third time.
meanings.sent3: The deafest student in the class pretended not to hear the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was the deafest barrier to their communication.
meanings.sent5: His closed-mindedness made him the deafest person in the room.
